description: Table T(n,k) = n mod k read by antidiagonals (n >= 1, k >= 1).
links: Boris Putievskiy, Transformations Integer Sequences And Pairing Functions arXiv:1212.2732 [math.CO], 2012.
formula: As a linear array, the sequence is a(n) = A002260(n) mod A004736 (n) or a(n) = (n-(t*(t+1)/2)) mod ((t*t+3*t+4)/2-n), where t = floor((-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 19 2012
mathematica: TableForm[Table[Mod[n, k], {n, 1, 16}, {k, 1, 16}]] (* A051126 array *)Table[Mod[n - k + 1, k], {n, 16}, {k, n, 1, -1}] // Flatten  (* A051126 sequence *)(* _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 04 2016 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 11 1999
